etymology.description: 星(star) + 巴克(phonetic for “bucks”) = Starbucks (coffee chain).
etymology.interpretation: Combines a semantic calque for “star” with a phonetic rendering of “bucks,” preserving both sound and imagery. Reads smoothly in Mandarin and carries positive, modern connotations.

parts.english: to long for; to cling/stick; Ba (ancient state); suffix in place names
to overcome; gram; to restrain; be able to

examples.chinese: 我们在星巴克见面吧(我們在星巴克見面吧)。
星巴克在很多城市都有门店(星巴克在很多城市都有門店)。
examples.pinyin: Xīngbākè zài hěn duō chéngshì dōu yǒu méndiàn.
examples.english: Starbucks has stores in many cities.

examples.chinese: 这家星巴克新推出了限定饮品(這家星巴克新推出了限定飲品)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā Xīngbākè xīn tuīchū le xiàndìng yǐnpǐn.
examples.english: This Starbucks just launched a limited-time drink.
